channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024060747
item.description:
Report X-2024060747

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CONTAIN 4 4LITER PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ALCOHOL, IN WHICH 1 BOTTLE LEAKED AT THE CLOSURE. THE REMAINING BOTTLES WERE CONTAMINATED, ENTIRE CONTENTS GOT PROCESSED THRU DMP BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2024060745
item.description:
Report X-2024060745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO THE EAST PRIMARY FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO OCNTAINERIZE THE LEAKING CONTAINER AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. CONTAINER AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON THE CONTAINER, MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND SOLIDIFIED, INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO ETT AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA, UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

item.title: Report E-2024060050
item.description:
Report E-2024060050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN2922 Trumpet EC release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 2’ x 20’ area of the concrete dock due to a fork puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-ounce of liquid released from the top cap of a lithium battery due to securement error. The battery was re-secured and continued in transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt confident cleaning the released material with the available PPE on site.

item.title: Report E-2024060104
item.description:
Report E-2024060104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately .50-Gallon of Kohler Black RAL9005 HS Urethane was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to improper packaging by terminal XID. The release impacted trailer #3171390. The product had already dried so no absorbent was needed. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID PACKAGE WEARING PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS AT BAY 172. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED ONE, FIVE GALLON METAL PAIL WITH A DENT ON THE BOTTOM AND A SMALL LEAK. RESPONDER CONTAINED THE SPILL AND PROCESSED IT THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024060429
item.description:
Report X-2024060429

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE TO PUERTO RICO HAD BROWN PAPER COVERING THE ENTIRE BOX. DURING PACKAGE HANDLING SOME OF THE PAPER WAS TORN EXPOSING A CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABEL. FURTHER REMOVAL OF THE PAPER REVEALED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKING OF UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PI 965 IA AND NET WEIGHT 21.03KG. THE BOX IS ALSO UN SPECIFICATION. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER BOX CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE ECOFLOW DELTA MAX (2000) PORTABLE POWER STATION. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RY6239, GATORADE SPORTS, 404 W HARRISON, CHICAGO IL 60607.

item.title: Report X-2024060215
item.description:
Report X-2024060215

  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO THE EAST PRIMARY FOR AN LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAG FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE, MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND SOLIDIFIED, AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.
